txt.en: 'You say Orcs are attacking? To the gate! We must defend Cliving!'
'[placeholder], if you could distract the guard across the way, we might be able to sneak out.\n\n'Stay with us when we move, however, for we may need your assistance along the way.'
Instance: Wary Riders
'We will continue from here alone... by the time word comes to Athelward of our departure, we will be well away from here.'
'What is it? A chicken coop?\n\n'Aye, we should avoid it... if the hens are disturbed, the noise will alert the guards.'
You have distracted the guard
'Do you see that stray hound ahead? Perhaps you can distract it with this jerky....'
The guard is distracted by the rock
'Thank you for your aid, my friend. Tomorrow, you should return to Reeve Athelward and let him know that we are grateful for his invitation, but must graciously decline.'
TBD
Speak with Burnoth.
The hound sniffs warily at the meat you proffer, then takes it and wanders away.
The hound snarls at you.
TBD
Lead the Riders Four to the stables
Burnoth wants you to distract the guard stationed across from his party's encampment.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>Help the Riders Four escape without being noticed.</rgb>
Convince the guards to leave their post
Lead the Riders Four to the stables.
Lead the Riders Four to the stables
Speak with Burnoth.
Talk to Burnoth
Lead the Riders Four to the stables.
There is a pile of rocks near the gate.\n\nYou might be able to distract the guard with a thrown rock.
Lead the Riders Four to the stables.
Use the jerky Burnoth gave you to distract the stray hound.
Use the jerky Burnoth gave you to distract the stray hound.
Wait for the guards to walk away
Talk to Burnoth
Distract the guard stationed across from the Riders' encampment
Lead the Riders Four to the stables
Talk to Burnoth
Lead the Riders Four to the stables
Throw a rock to distract the guard
Lead the Riders Four to the stables
Talk to Burnoth
Distract the hound with Burnoth's jerky
<rgb=#00FFFF>There is a hen-house ahead...you should avoid startling the chickens within.</rgb>
Lead the Riders Four to the stables.
Convince the guards to leave their post.
Lead the Riders Four to the stables.
'Let us go... let us be swift, but silent.'
Discomfitted by Reeve Athelward's unusually pleasant demeanor and apparent disregard for the severity of Rohan's situation, Burnoth decides to leave Cliving by night.
Speak with Burnoth.
'Another guard! Perhaps you may find a way to distract this one as well? When the guard is distracted, we will continue.'
'Do you see that stray hound ahead? Perhaps you can distract it with this jerky....'
'There are two more guards ahead... one more distraction, and we will make the stables.'
You inform the guard that you believe you saw riders approaching the city.\n\n'I will go and look, for it is late, and there should be no Riders about.'
